summary: Key findings on BOJ rate hike probability before May 1, 2026
content:
## Current State
- BOJ at 0.75% after Dec 2025 hike from 0.5%
- Held steady Jan 23, 2026 (unanimously expected)
- BOJ raised growth/inflation forecasts in January
- Board member Takata dissented, wanted to hike to 1%

## BOJ Meetings Before May 1
- March meeting (~March 12-13)
- April 27-28 meeting (just within the May 1 deadline)

## Analyst Views
- Reuters poll: majority expect July for next hike
- >75% expect rate to reach 1%+ by September
- BOJ insiders: see April as "distinct possibility" (CNBC Jan 16)
- Citigroup: April possible if yen breaks 160
- State Street: base case 1 hike in 2026, could be April if yen weakens
- ING: expects October 2026

## Political Context
- PM Takaichi called snap election for Feb 8, 2026
- She is a fiscal dove/reflationist who challenged BOJ independence
- But analysts say she may delay but not derail BOJ hikes
- Inflation makes it hard to push back too hard on BOJ

## Economic Context
- Strong wage growth: Rengo asking for 5% in 2026 shunto (got 5.25% in 2025)
- Inflation persistently above 2%
- Economy contracted Q3 2025 but BOJ upgraded forecasts
- Low unemployment at 2.6%

## Market Pricing
- 1-year OIS at 0.84% as of mid-Dec 2025 (implies <1 full hike in 12 months)
- Markets pricing gradual normalization
